definition: time-consuming/to take a period of (x amount of time)
to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally

sentences.english: The physical model can get dynamic effect, but it would consume great time.
sentences.chinese: 物理模型可得到精确的动态效果，但比较耗时。

sentences.english: The higher the frame-rate, the less time there is to do this work.
sentences.chinese: 帧速率越高，这一步骤耗时就要越少。

sentences.english: He tries to catch volcanoes when they are their highest levels of activity, but calculating the ups and downs of the eruptions can take days to complete.
sentences.chinese: 但是考虑到火山喷发，跌宕起伏，须耗时数日。

sentences.english: Assume it will take far longer than any other project you've previously done.
sentences.chinese: 要料想到它可能比你以往的其他项目更耗时间。

sentences.english: The time spent reading reference materials was also added to the total preparation time.
sentences.chinese: 这个耗时的阅读参考资料也要算作预备工作的时间。

sentences.english: Rowe's son Tyler filmed the documentary over a five year period.
sentences.chinese: 罗的儿子泰勒耗时五年拍摄了这部纪录片。

sentences.english: Travelling just 60 miles drive from the capital, Kinshasa, can take about eight hours.
sentences.chinese: 从首都金沙萨开出仅仅60英里，就要耗时八小时。

sentences.english: Construction began in 1632 and took about 15 years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 建造始于1632年，大约耗时15年才全部建成。

sentences.english: Building altogether a new rule set is expensive and time-consuming.
sentences.chinese: 集中构建一个新规则集既具有高成本有很耗时。

sentences.english: If the employer wants to hire, there is the time-consuming chore of sifting through applications.
sentences.chinese: 如果企业想要招聘，筛选申请人的工作就非常耗时。

sentences.english: Capturing an image with an electron microscope is a time consumingand expensive process.
sentences.chinese: 用电子显微镜捕捉一个图像是耗时而昂贵的过程。

sentences.english: The half-hour test is around five years away from widespread use.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试耗时半小时，有望在五年内广泛推广。

sentences.english: The traditional way is time-consuming and need great effort.
sentences.chinese: 传统上这项工作不仅耗力而且耗时。

sentences.english: The train would travel at 220mph with the entire trip taking two days.
sentences.chinese: 高铁将以220英里的时速运行，全程旅行耗时两天。

sentences.english: The long running back-end call is simulated.
sentences.chinese: 这里模拟了耗时的后端调用。

definition: to extend as long as/to lengthen out to
many and complicated/mired in minor details
saving/to save/to use sparingly/to cut down on
gap/interval/compartment/to divide/to separate/to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
